lines.text: I'm so angry I could shake you!
I only wanted to explain about the polish...
...so you told Miss Sims I was meeting a *boy*! It's a wonder you didn't tell her who and where!
I didn't know where!
I was sick all night!
That's a lie, Donald. You weren't sick.
I could've been sick if I wanted to.
What's the meaning of goodness if there isn't a little badness to overcome?
I want it all quickly 'cause I don't want God to stop and think and wonder if I'm getting more than my share.
whether it's better to do the right thing for the wrong reason or the wrong thing for the right reason.
Some day you'll learn that greatness is only the seizing of opportunity - clutching with your bare hands 'til the knuckles show white.
So you're to win the gelding, are you Velvet?
Oh, of course I'm to win.
There are ways of arranging it, aren't there? And your father's a clever man...
Oh, I didn't bother him, Mr. Hallam. I just arranged it with God.
[Mrs. Brown is talking with Velvet in the attic]

We're alike. I, too, believe that everyone should have a chance at a breathtaking piece of folly once in his life. I was twenty when they said a woman couldn't swim the Channel. You're twelve; you think a horse of yours can win the Grand National. Your dream has come early; but remember, Velvet, it will have to last you all the rest of your life.
[Mi is trying to tell Velvet the "tricks" for the Grand National]
Don't, Mi! No matter what you say or do everyone else out there will know more than me. It's no use, Mi.
Do think a race like this is won by luck?
No, by knowing the Pi can win and telling him so!
I was sick all night!
Donald, you told a story, didn't you?
Yes, sir, it was a story.
Well, you know what to do.
What?
You say you're sorry.
[Donald puts his head on his hand]
Well?
He's thinking.

[to Donald]
Well, make up your mind.
Alright, I'm sorry.
[continues eating his dinner]
Well, go on. Sorry for what?
For being sick all night!
That boy will make a lawyer.
Who's been in my box?
Me.

[correcting him]
"I."
You, too?
It's one thing to out-think a man, quite another to outsmart him.
And who will say which is which?
I want my insect bottle!
Shut up and stop being disgusting.
Donald, go back to bed.
I'll only fall asleep.
That is the general purport and intention.

[Sees Edwina polishing Donald's toenails]
What sort of savagery is this?
Paint!
Only in fun, Father. We thought it would look pretty.
I don't like it!
The child doesn't like it. Wipe it off.
I don't mind it.
He's beautiful, Mr. Ede. What's his name?
Name? He's a murderous pirate, not deserving of a name.
Oh no, not pirate. He's a gentle one. I'll just call him Pi.

[Velvet is pretending she's riding The Pi]
Who's this Pi? A new one?
Oh, Father, you should see him, he's beautiful. He never puts a foot wrong.
Who?
Mr. Ede's new horse. I'm in love with him.
You're a fickle woman. I've heard you say that about other horses.
